alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 9:43AM EST until March 05 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following county, Stark. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 925 AM EST, river gages along Nimishillen Creek report flooding, including along the West Branch of Nimishillen Creek near Canton. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.2 inches of rain fell yesterday. - The gage on the West Branch of the Nimishillen Creek reached 14.2 feet or major flood stage, early this morning. As of 930 AM EST, the gage on the West Branch of Nimishillen Creek near Canton was at 13.5 feet and falling. Flooding is still ongoing near Water Works Park in Canton. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Canton, North Canton, Louisville, Hartville, East Sparta, Meyers Lake, Hills And Dales and Perry Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
